name: unconsciousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of not being awake and not aware of things around you, especially as the result of a head injury: She drifted into unconsciousness. Anaesthetics directly affect the brain and produce unconsciousness. See
unconscious
More examplesFewer examplesLow blood sugar, if not treated, can cause unconsciousness.He suggested Michelle was faking unconsciousness.Bleeding on the brain could bring unconsciousness and eventual death.
